title: 114_hr4302
content: The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. The Secretary must report this determination to Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of functions transferred to them, resolving outstanding obligations, and taking necessary actions to dissolve any remaining affairs of the Bank. They may delegate functions as needed and no positions or functions of the Bank are authorized after 60 days of abolishment. Conforming amendments and repeals are also included in the Act. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including various sections from Acts such as the Export-Import Bank Act Amendments of 1978, Bank Export Services Act, Public Law 90-390, Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, and Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related provisions are repealed, including amendments from various Acts. Specific sections are amended or eliminated, such as subsections in the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 and positions in title 5 of the United States Code. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related provisions are repealed, including amendments from various Acts. Positions at level iv in title 5 of the United States Code are amended, and the Office of Inspector General for the Bank is eliminated. The repeals and amendments made by this section shall take effect on the abolishment date. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related provisions are repealed, including amendments from various Acts. Positions at level iv in title 5 of the United States Code are amended, and the Office of Inspector General for the Bank is eliminated. The repeals and amendments made by this section shall take effect on the abolishment date. Additionally, the Secretary will submit a report to Congress suggesting other necessary amendments to Federal statutes resulting from this Act. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal law, executive order, rule, regulation, or document pertaining to a department or office is deemed to refer to the department or office to which the function is transferred. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. "Function" includes duty, power, or program. "Office" includes any organizational entity.
